cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi E of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northwest, then turning north-northeast toward the north-central Gulf Coast with landfall expected along the Mississippi/Alabama coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Biloxi, Mississippi to the AL/MS border

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River westward to Grand Isle, LA, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft inundation possible at the mouth of the Mississippi River and adjacent Plaquemines coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches with isolated 30 inch totals possible, producing life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents affecting vessel approaches.
